Ceny kawy poszły w górę. Jeden gatunek drożeje najszybciej
articles.summary: Rosną ceny kawy, a eksperci zapowiadają, że będzie jeszcze drożej, chociaż obejdzie się raczej bez "szoków cenowych". W 2025 r. kawa mielona podrożała o ponad 30 proc., dwukrotnie więcej niż rozpuszczalna. W tym roku wiele będzie zależeć od dostępności surowca i stabilności upraw. Autorzy raportu o cenach kawy wyjaśniają, które gatunki drożeją szybciej i dlaczego.

articles.title: Trump chwali się "ogromną umową". Japonia zainwestuje miliardy w te projekty
articles.summary: Prezydent USA Donald Trump ogłosił, że Japonia zainwestuje w projekty dotyczące energii i minerałów krytycznych w Teksasie, Ohio i Georgii. To pierwsze japońskie inwestycje w USA w ramach zawartej w ubiegłym roku dwustronnej umowy handlowej.

articles.title: Świat w erze niedoborów. Geopolityka pisze nowe reguły biznesu
articles.summary: Rok 2025 był czasem zwiększonej niepewności, a otoczenie biznesowe w 2026 r. będzie kształtowane przez dwa najważniejsze trendy: nowe zasady i normy oraz geopolitykę niedoborów

articles.title: Ile będzie nas kosztował program SAFE? Ministerstwo zdradza liczby
articles.summary: Oprocentowanie pożyczki z programu SAFE będzie zmienne, a w pierwszym roku wyniesie 3,17 proc., wynika z informacji przekazanych przez Ministerstwo Finansów w czasie obrad senackich komisji. Senatorowie chcą wprowadzić poprawkę, zgodnie z którą pożyczka nie byłaby spłacan

articles.title: FAA abruptly halted El Paso flights over Defense Department's plans for anti-drone technology
articles.summary: A Trump administration official said the Department of Defense disabled Mexican cartel drones that had breached U.S. airspace.

articles.title: Novo Nordisk faces a defining year in the obesity drug market. It’s off to a dramatic start
articles.summary: The Danish drugmaker kicked off 2026 with its explosive obesity pill launch, but recent challenges have centered around protecting its market share.

articles.title: Why the largest U.S. auto dealer isn't interested in Chinese cars — for now
articles.summary: But reasons such as politics, logistics or potential consumer backlash aren't necessarily the main reasons, according to Lithia Motors CEO Bryan DeBoer.

articles.title: Novo Nordisk CEO sees 15 million patient opportunity in Medicare coverage for obesity drugs
articles.summary: Doustdar said Medicare coverage and the launch of Novo's new obesity pill should help gradually boost prescription volumes and offset lower prices in the U.S.

articles.title: Scripps launches cost cutting, AI integration in latest effort to generate earnings growth
articles.summary: CEO Adam Symson said in an interview with CNBC the changes are intended to alleviate journalists from administrative tasks, but not replace them with AI.

articles.title: Netflix grants WBD waiver to reopen deal talks with Paramount, Sarandos says 'let them make a move'
articles.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery on Tuesday said it will engage in deal talks with Paramount Skydance under a 7-day waiver from Netflix.

articles.title: CFTC defends its right to prediction market enforcement as states challenge platforms
articles.summary: CFTC Chairman Michael Selig said the agency has filed an amicus brief to assert its authority over prediction market enforcement and regulation.

articles.title: Ford to follow Tesla Cybertruck with electrical tech in new EV pickup
articles.summary: Ford's next generation of all-electric vehicles will feature a budding technology commercialized by Tesla in the U.S. on its Cybertruck.

articles.title: Lakers governor Jeanie Buss talks year of transition, says father would have supported sale to Mark Walter
articles.summary: Los Angeles Lakers governor Jeanie Buss said new majority owner Mark Walter's access to capital will help the team best compete with the NBA's top franchises.

articles.title: Dave's Hot Chicken investors bet on birria with national franchise expansion plan
articles.summary: Once known as a regional Mexican food, birria now appears on 3.7% of U.S. menus, according to Datassential.

articles.title: American Airlines flight attendants picket as CEO tries to calm frustrated employees
articles.summary: The union that represents American's 28,000 cabin crew members issued a vote of no confidence of CEO Robert Isom.

articles.title: Spirit Airlines sells more planes, calls back 500 flight attendants from furlough ahead of spring break
articles.summary: Spirit Airlines said it sold another 20 planes and is calling back 500 flight attendants from furlough.

articles.title: Restaurant Brands shares fall despite earnings beat, strong international growth
articles.summary: Outside of the U.S. and Canada, Restaurant Brands' same-store sales climbed 6.1%.

articles.title: Realtors report a 'new housing crisis' as January home sales tank more than 8%
articles.summary: Home sales in January fell more than expected as mortgage rates didn't move much and consumer confidence dropped.

articles.title: McDonald’s earnings beat estimates as chain’s value push pays off
articles.summary: Buzzy promotions have helped McDonald's win over high-income consumers.

articles.title: Lunar New Year gives luxury brands a chance to win back big spenders in China
articles.summary: The Chinese luxury market is expected to turnaround this year, but Western brands can't afford to be complacent, analysts said.

articles.title: AI disruption could spark a ‘shock to the system’ in credit markets, UBS analyst says
articles.summary: UBS analyst Matthew Mish told CNBC that the artificial intelligence transformation is happening faster than he and his colleagues had previously anticipated.

articles.title: Rivian tops fourth-quarter expectations, targets significant production increase
articles.summary: Rivian's 2026 guidance includes increasing vehicle deliveries to between 62,000 and 67,000 units, which would be up by 47% to 59% compared to 2025.

articles.title: How packaging and logistics companies are automating their warehouses
articles.summary: Companies like UPS, FedEx and DHL are increasingly turning to automation in their warehouse processes to work toward greater efficiency and lower costs.
